text:
𝐄𝐠𝐠𝐬 𝐁𝐞𝐧𝐞𝐝𝐢𝐜𝐭
Poached eggs, leg ham, English muffin, hollandaise
(Makes 2 servings)
Ingredients:
English Muffin – 2 pcs
Butter, spread
Leg Ham, shaved - 120g
For Hollandaise Sauce:
Black peppercorn, cracked – 2 pcs
Cider/white vinegar – 90ml
Egg yolk – 4
Melted butter, warm – 300ml
Lemon juice – ¼ 
Salt and pepper to taste
For poached eggs:
Water - 1.5 litre
Salt – 1 tbsp
Distilled white vinegar – 15ml
Eggs – 4
Hollandaise Sauce:
1.	Combine peppercorns and vinegar in a pot and simmer to reduce till 60ml. Strain reduction into a mixing bowl.
2.	Whisk the egg yolks together with the reduction placed over simmering water. Whisk constantly until the egg mixture is thicken and forms ribbons when they fall from the whisk.
3.	Gradually add the warm melted butter, whisking constantly until all the butter is added and the sauce is thickened. 
4.	Add lemon juice, salt and white pepper for taste. 
5.	To keep sauce warm, keep it in a warm thermal flask
Poached Eggs:
1.	Combine water, salt and vinegar in a pot and bring to a simmer.
2.	Break each egg into a clean bowl and then slide the eggs carefully into the poaching water. Cook for 3-5 minutes or until the whites are set and opaque.
3.	Remove eggs from the water with a slotted spoon, blot them on a towel. Serve eggs on top of ham. 
Assemble:
1.	Cut muffin in half, spread with soft butter and toast them on hot pan till brown and crisp.
2.	Remove muffin, place muffin on a plate and sear ham in the hot pan till warm and brown.
3.	Place ham on the muffin with a poach egg on the top. 
4.	Ladle warm hollandaise over each egg. 
5.	Serve immediately. 
#BringItHome #UrbanaRooftopBar #BrunchRecipe #CourtyardSingapore #SGUnited #SINCYStayHomeRecipe #SINCYMothersDaySpecial #MothersDay #MarriottBonvoy #EggsBenedict
